condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened political commitment and accountability to legislate and budget for strengthening interventions that prevent and respond to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect

description.narrative: UNICEF's persistent advocacy, dialogue and support, alone and together with UN and other partners, continued to drive the family and child protection reform agenda in the sub-region and urge ratification of the CRC Optional Protocols. While there were no further ratifications in the reporting period, countries continued to make steady progress in drafting and enacting sub-regional model legislation to better protect children and their families, completed their reform action plans, and investigated and reflected on the models of legal representation for children as victims, defendants and witnesses, and their consequences for children's best interests. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of legislation prohibiting all forms of corporal punishment of children, by setting (all settings, and by setting: home, schools, alternative care settings and day care, as a disciplinary measure in penal institutions/detention, and as a sentence for an offence)

actual.value: 2020:No country. Parliamentary approval in St. Lucia planned for May 2020 deferred due to Covid-19.

title.narrative: Key articles of the CRC (Art. 19, Art. 34 and Art. 38 Optional Protocol on the sale of children, child prostitution and child pornography and Optional Protocol on the involvement of children in armed conflict) dealing with violence, exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into the national legislation.
